item.dc:creator: @Napalmist Napalmist
item.description:
@Napalmist wrote:

I hope you do <3
It’s a golden idea, you could easily make updates, new outfits and spells for the game. You just need the server and client all set. Which, I know is hard but you know how to do the client right? Well, the server side of things can be easily obtained the same way, right? I could be wrong but yeah, please don’t give up ;-;

item.title: Arcanists Client
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Well I’m just generating one from their webserver and reading it, works like a charm.

I finally found the methods for spellcasting, so I’m working on refactoring as much of those as I can. My aim right now is actually to maybe make an ‘aim assist’ that shows you where your spells will go

EDIT - can someone move this to talk about other games, please
EDIT2 - Ty Si Force<3

Read full topic

item.title: Arcanists Client
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

It probably has to do with session verification. If the session isn’t properly verified, the incoming connection is probably flagged and thereafter ignored (or perhaps partially ignored, as given the weird scenario).

Read full topic

item.title: Arcanists Client
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

It’s so context based that I don’t think any of us will be able to answer it. It’s not exactly a common error, and there could be many causes. We’d obviously need to look through it and, unfortunately, I know I don’t have any time to. Just try to sniff a real arcanist session and compare the legitimate “spell” packets to the ones your client is sending.

Read full topic

item.title: Arcanists Client
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

So does anyone know why it might be doing this?

[quote=“Davidi2, post:22, topic:434571”]In game I can’t cast any spells… I mean like, it wont send them to the server at all. It all works client sided (as the above image shows), but there seems to be a bug somewhere when it’s trying to send the spell. So you’ll cast it, your turn will end, but then nothing will happen. And if you move around, you’ll jump back where you started at the end of your turn.[/quote]I checked and it does seem to be sending them to the server, so I dunno. Chat and everything else still works.

I guess I’ll just start reverse engineering a server and see if I can fix it myself if nobody can think of anything

Read full topic

item.title: Arcanists Client
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[tt]Class_uj void_method794(int i, byte[] is, int i_4_, int i_5_)[/tt] is the main read method from the server by the way (obviously reads into [tt]is[/tt])

For everything pre-login:

an_Class_uj_296.void_method794(i_2_, an_Class_on_299.an_an_byte_array3254_3254, -1, an_Class_on_299.an_int_3253); in Class_kc

Then after that it’s:

Class_fd.an_Class_uj_1124.void_method794(i_7_, Class_pf.an_Class_cb_3287.an_an_byte_array3254_3254, -1, Class_pf.an_Class_cb_3287.an_int_3253); in Class_fj

Read full topic

item.title: Arcanists Client
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

if you don’t mind that my debug things still being in there, here it is

http://server290.uppit.com/files/9/u9t1ffquzntezi/src.rar

anything without a ‘class_’ prefix is from the loader (except ArcanistsMulti)

(if you put it in an IDE it will say a few of the classes have errors in them, it’s actually important that you don’t fix those yet, especially the one that extends the netscape package)

Read full topic

item.title: Arcanists Client
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:

like taharok said ours would crash once the login packet was sent if you don’t mind uploading the source i would be interested in seeing it

Read full topic

item.title: Arcanists Client
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Fixed it

The deobber did have one mistake (or something it forgot to change), a lot of the time it would put in ‘–’ instead of -1, which as you can guess messed up a loop during the graphics loading quite a bit (by making it an endless loop)

Sorry about the ‘all duns’, that’s how I debug haha

In game I can’t cast any spells… I mean like, it wont send them to the server at all. It all works client sided (as the above image shows), but there seems to be a bug somewhere when it’s trying to send the spell. So you’ll cast it, your turn will end, but then nothing will happen. And if you move around, you’ll jump back where you started at the end of your turn. Probably some issues with the deobfuscated stream classes, which if we make a private server we’ll have to look at anyways

Read full topic

item.title: Arcanists Client
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:17, topic:434571”][quote author=vortex link=topic=537289.msg3930212#msg3930212 date=1330612441]

[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=537289.msg3930190#msg3930190 date=1330610566]

Take “wa” out from the archive, put it in your classpath and run ZKM, this way it should run but it won’t rename it.
[/quote]Thanks, worked like a charm

for the exceptions, there are plenty of open source transforms for removing/fixing them…
[/quote]Now this is my next priority, can you give me an example?

Try this, it was made by some dude from rune-serber (some of the plugins worked quite well on the current RSC client)
http://uppit.com/ebtp2fqj44li/classtransformer_build_2.0.1.zip

I’m confused, it says it is licensed under the GNU/GPL yet has no source code in it? Is there another release WITH source code?[/quote]I’m not sure. I can only find this:
http://google.com/runescape-development/rs-503-client-server/downloads/310886-deobfuscator.html
Which is a much older version (1.4?) but it does have the source code

It really did do exactly what I needed though, worked perfectly. Just ran the deobfuscator then the renamer for classes and methods, then the decompiler, and 99.9% of the issues were fixed.

Read full topic

item.title: Arcanists Client
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“vortex, post:15, topic:434571”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=537289.msg3930190#msg3930190 date=1330610566]

[quote author=vortex link=topic=537289.msg3930117#msg3930117 date=1330599142]
Take “wa” out from the archive, put it in your classpath and run ZKM, this way it should run but it won’t rename it.
[/quote]Thanks, worked like a charm

for the exceptions, there are plenty of open source transforms for removing/fixing them…
[/quote]Now this is my next priority, can you give me an example?

Try this, it was made by some dude from rune-serber (some of the plugins worked quite well on the current RSC client)
http://uppit.com/ebtp2fqj44li/classtransformer_build_2.0.1.zip[/quote]
I’m confused, it says it is licensed under the GNU/GPL yet has no source code in it? Is there another release WITH source code?

Read full topic

item.title: Arcanists Client
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“vortex, post:15, topic:434571”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=537289.msg3930190#msg3930190 date=1330610566]

[quote author=vortex link=topic=537289.msg3930117#msg3930117 date=1330599142]
Take “wa” out from the archive, put it in your classpath and run ZKM, this way it should run but it won’t rename it.
[/quote]Thanks, worked like a charm

for the exceptions, there are plenty of open source transforms for removing/fixing them…
[/quote]Now this is my next priority, can you give me an example?

Try this, it was made by some dude from rune-serber (some of the plugins worked quite well on the current RSC client)
http://uppit.com/ebtp2fqj44li/classtransformer_build_2.0.1.zip[/quote]woah thats pretty cool, playing around with it now
EDIT- Exactly what I needed! Thanks both of ya. Literally all the errors are gone besides the strange Directx(?) ones. And when I was browsing the references it seems like it may not even need them, we’ll see.

EDIT2 - (this is after logging in)

kesBj.png1027×690

for the exceptions, there are plenty of open source transforms for removing/fixing them…
